item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start!

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, here’s exactly how to do that!

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go!
Vault guides tags metadata Rename tags for classes theme hub note compendium templates

[[Tyndall Test]] [[Pure Substance]]s: [[Matter]], [[Element]], [[Compound]] [[Mixtures]]: [[Solution]], [[Colloid]], [[Suspension]] [[Physical vs Chemical Change]]

[[Law of Conservation of Mass]] [[Law of Definite Proportions]] [[Chemical Atomic Theory]] [[Discovery of the Atom]] [[Democritis]], [[Lavoisier]], [[Proust]], [[Dalton]], [[Faraday]], [[Roentgen]], [[Bequerrel]] [[Curie]] [[Cathode Ray]], [[Cathode Ray Experiments]]

Tool labelling Tool Image Round-Nose ![[attachments/A4835AF3-AF22-4A37-B634-7BA41AD4C6B8.jpeg|256]] Chain-Nose ![[attachments/8A12B3F0-FD67-4F76-A738-0DCEFAA6294F.jpeg|256]] Flat-Nose !
[[Trait]]s that are judged by how something behaves in the presence of another [[Substance]] ex: [[Iron]] [[Oxidation|rusts]] in [[Oxygen]] [[Noble Gas]] are not very [[Reactivity|Reactive]]
just a test
just a test
Basic building block of matter (excluding the [[Elementary Particles]]), cannot be broken down EX: [[Hydrogen]], [[Oxygen]]
A [[Trait]] that varies / is dependent ex: [[State Of Matter]] [[Mass]] [[Volume]]
Appears different throughout
Appearing the same throughout
A [[Trait]] that is specific / independent ex: [[Color]] [[Odor]] [[Texture]] [[Melting Point]] [[Solubility]] [[Boiling Point]]
ex: [[Color]] [[Odor]] [[Texture]] [[State Of Matter]] [[Melting Point]] [[Solubility]] [[Density]] [[Mass]] [[Volumr]]

[[Physical Change]]: Change in [[Physical Properties]] (alteration in size, shape, or [[State Of Matter|State]]) No change in [[Chemical Properties]] ex: [[Freezing]] <—> [[Melting]] [[Boiling]] <—> [[Condensating]] Grinding, cutting [[Chemical Change]]: Alteration in [[Chemical Properties]] of matter due to new arrangement ex: [[Burning]] [[Oxidation]] $\text{Fe}_5 + \text{O}_2 = \text{Fe}_2\text{O}_3$ possible signs include: $\Delta$ Change in [[Color]] [[Gas]] emitted (ex: bubbles) $\Delta$ Change in [[Energy]] Release ([[Exothermic Reaction]]) Absorb ([[Endothermic Reaction]]) $\Delta$ Change in [[Mass]] [[Precipitation]]
$$ \frac{238}{92}U + \frac{1}{0}n \rightarrow \frac{239}{92}U + \text{gamma rays} $$

Directory structure 1_vault For vault-related files (ex: attachments, templates) 2_stuff For all content that I make, mostly notes and ideas (ex: [[Elementary Particles]]) 3_compendium For worldbuilding

item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 .

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: ‚Äú[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.

item.title: Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden Scaling Synthesis - A hypertext research notebook AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard Data Dictionary üß† sspaeti.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :)

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update!
